description: Explore the modern features of HTML5 including semantic elements, native audio/video support, and the canvas API.

slides.title: What is HTML5?
slides.content:
# The Modern Web: HTML5 üöÄ

HTML5 is the latest major version of HTML.

## Key Improvements
- **Semantic Elements**: Better document structure (`<article>`, `<header>`)
- **Multimedia**: Native audio and video support
- **Graphics**: 2D/3D graphics with `<canvas>` and SVG
- **APIs**: Geolocation, Drag and Drop, Local Storage

It is designed to deliver rich content without the need for additional plugins (like Flash).

slides.title: Semantic Elements
slides.content:
# Semantic Elements üèõÔ∏è

A semantic element clearly describes its meaning to both the **browser** and the **developer**.

**Non-semantic:** `<div>` and `<span>` - tells nothing about its content.
**Semantic:** `<form>`, `<table>`, and `<article>` - clearly defines its content.

## New Semantic Tags in HTML5
- `<header>`
- `<footer>`
- `<article>`
- `<section>`
- `<nav>`
- `<aside>`

slides.title: HTML Video
slides.content:
# HTML Video üé¨

Before HTML5, a video could only be played with a plug-in (like flash). 
HTML5 defines a standard way to embed video.

```html
<video width="320" height="240" controls>
  <source src="movie.mp4" type="video/mp4">
  <source src="movie.ogg" type="video/ogg">
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>
```

- `controls`: Adds play, pause, and volume controls.
- `<source>`: Try different formats (MP4, WebM, Ogg) until one works.

slides.title: HTML Audio
slides.content:
# HTML Audio üîä

To play an audio file in HTML, use the `<audio>` element.

```html
<audio controls>
  <source src="horse.ogg" type="audio/ogg">
  <source src="horse.mp3" type="audio/mpeg">
  Your browser does not support the audio element.
</audio>
```

## Attributes
- `autoplay`: Starts playing automatically (often blocked by browsers).
- `loop`: Replays the audio file when it finishes.
- `muted`: Mutes the audio output.

slides.title: SVG Graphics
slides.content:
# SVG Graphics üìê

**SVG** stands for Scalable Vector Graphics.

- SVG is used to define vector-based graphics for the Web.
- SVG defines the graphics in XML format.
- SVGs do not lose quality if they are zoomed or resized.

```html
<svg width="100" height="100">
  <circle cx="50" cy="50" r="40" stroke="green" stroke-width="4" fill="yellow" />
</svg>
```

Differences from Canvas:
- **SVG**: Vector based, part of DOM (event handlers), better for logos/charts.
- **Canvas**: Raster based (pixels), high performance (games), no DOM for drawn objects.

slides.content: # Drag and Drop üëã HTML5 has a standard Drag and Drop API. Any element can be draggable. ```html ``` Basic steps: 1. set `draggable="true"` 2. handle `ondragstart` event (what data to drag) 3. handle `ondragover` event (allow dropping) 4. handle `ondrop` event (handle the drop)

slides.title: Local Storage
slides.content:
# Web Storage üß†

HTML5 web storage, better than cookies.

## localStorage
Stores data with no expiration date.

```js
localStorage.setItem("lastname", "Smith");
alert(localStorage.getItem("lastname"));
```

## sessionStorage
Stores data for one session (data is lost when the browser tab is closed).

```js
sessionStorage.setItem("lastname", "Smith");
```

slides.title: Web Workers
Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: HTML5 üéì

HTML5 brings power and structure to the web.

- **Semantics:** Clean, meaningful code (`<nav>`, `<article>`, `<header>`).
- **Multimedia:** No more plugins (`<video>`, `<audio>`).
- **Graphics:** Stunning visuals (`<canvas>`, `<svg>`).
- **APIs:** Powerful capabilities (`Geolocation`, `Storage`, `Workers`).
